item.title: Report E-2025040642
item.description:
Report E-2025040642

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-24T15:13:38+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-20
  • City: PENSACOLA
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: It was reported that 30-gallons of gasoline released due to an overfill from a third-party fuel carrier. The spill impacted the asphalt parking lot. ERTS dispatched environmental contractor, HEPACO to the site. HEPACO personnel arrive onsite and advised the third-party fuel carrier had already cleaned the spill. HEPACO advised no nearby storm drains were impacted by the release.

item.title: Report E-2025040560
item.description:
Report E-2025040560

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-23T00:57:51+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-08
  • City: Pine Level
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: AIRGAS SPECIALTY PRODUCTS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: 1" product hose acme fitting dragged on road surface after static coupling and retaining bungee strap failed. When discovered, driver called and reported to management, then re-secured hose-end and diverted to carrier/shipper equipment domicile. Release was limited to product in hose between hose-end and on-way check-valve, approx 100ft x 1" nominal bore = 21 lbs NH3 slow release. Release as a result of coupling valve stem dragging on ground and opening slightly, releasing product.

item.title: Report E-2025040503
item.description:
Report E-2025040503

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: PALM CITY
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 18, 2025, thirty-six (36) pails of hydrochloric acid were damaged and released approximately three (3) gallons of product to the asphalt. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the site. The crew neutralized the asphalt and utilized absorbents and hand tools to further remediate the site. All impacted materials and the damaged pails were containerized in four (4) 85-gallon overpacks and two (2) 55-gallon drums.

item.title: Report E-2025040471
item.description:
Report E-2025040471

Identified by scraper @ 2025-05-18T21:15:32+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: MIAMI
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CEVA FREIGHT, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On April 18, 2025, at 1513 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by CEVA Logistic personnel in Miami, FL regarding the release of Aprosolve Methanol. The spill consisted of approximately 1 ounce of Aprosolve Methanol (UN1230, 3, II), which leaked from 1-5 gallon metal drum and impacted a concrete dock. CEVA personnel stated the consignee refused the freight. The damaged drum was returned to the terminal where they advised they will place the damaged drum, remaining waste inside, and oil-dri into a 55-gallon DF for disposal.
